From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


2022 American found footage horror film
He's WatchingOfficial release posterDirected byJacob Aaron EstesWritten byJacob Aaron EstesProduced byJacob Aaron EstesIris Serena EstesLucas Steel EstesGretchen LieberumStarring
Iris Serena Estes
Lucas Steel Estes
CinematographyJacob Aaron EstesEdited byJacob Aaron EstesMusic byKeefus CianciaProductioncompanyXYZ FilmsRelease date21 July 2022CountryUnited StatesLanguageEnglish
He's Watching is a 2022 American found footage horror film written and directed by Jacob Aaron Estes, starring Iris Serena Estes and Lucas Steel Estes.[1][2]
The film was released on July 21, 2022,[3] and received positive reviews from critics.


Plot[edit]
A brother and sister discover a presence in their home while their parents are in the hospital suffering a mystery illness that seems to only affect adults. The siblings team up to discover what the presence is and how to escape it.

Cast[edit]
Iris Serena Estes as Iris Serena Estes
Lucas Steel Estes as Lucas Steel Estes
Release[edit]
The film was released to video on demand on 21 July 2022.[4]

Reception[edit]
On review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes, the film holds an approval rating of 88% based on 8 reviews, with an average rating of 6.70/10.[5]
Chad Collins of Dread Central rated the film four stars out of five, writing: "Hypnotic and unique, He’s Watching is a testament to the staying power of found footage".[6] Emily von Seele of the Daily Dead rated the film 3.5 stars out of five.[7] The film received a positive review in Screen Anarchy.[8]

^ Musnicky, Sarah (2022-07-14). "[News] Supernatural Thriller HE'S WATCHING Arrives on VOD July 21". Nightmarish Conjurings. Retrieved 2023-05-02.

^ Miska, Brad (14 July 2022). "'He's Watching' – The Closet Creeper Stalks a Family on July 21 [Trailer]". Bloody Disgusting. Retrieved 30 July 2022.

^ Canfield, Dave (27 July 2022). "Review: HE'S WATCHING, Stark Reminder of How Powerful Found Footage Can Be". ScreenAnarchy. Retrieved 30 July 2022.
